markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Visap](/Weapons.aspx?ID=268)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Injection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=407" />
<trait label="Versatile P" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=200" />
<trait label="Vishkanya" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=369" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Impossible Lands](/Sources.aspx?ID=146) pg. 221</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 2 gp

**Damage** 1d4 S

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Knife](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=9)
</row>

</column>

---

Two small, curved blades extend from a single hilt. There's a hollow area inside that vishkanyas can use to store an unused dose of their blood, or other poison, for the future.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-9" />
name: Visap

There's a hollow area inside that vishkanyas can use to store an unused dose of their blood, or other poison, for the future. Critical Specialization Effects Source Core Rulebook pg. 283 4.0 Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success.
